learning_outcomes.description: Apply contemporary behaviour change theories with marketing co-design methods to produce an educational campaign.
Demonstrate an understanding of how to promote equitable health services to support Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to attain equitable health outcomes.
Demonstrate entry level ability to plan, implement or evaluate nutrition education/promotion programs
Apply quality management principles in public health and community nutrition
Demonstrate cultural awareness alongside professional ethical and entrepreneurial approach in public health and community nutrition practice

assessments.task_description: This is an individual task. This assessment should be completed after engaging with Module 2 and Module 3 of the Understanding Cultural Safety modules on Blackboard (in-class). Students are asked to reflect on their learnings from Module 2 and Module 3 of the Understanding Cultural Safety modules and apply their new knowledge of culturally safe practice to their own discipline.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will co-design an resource for a specific target group and construct a social media post which promotes the new resource. See Blackboard for details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Learning Plan

Due 5:00pm, end of week 1 of placement

Competency Assessment - Interim Assessment

Due 5:00pm, end of week 2 of placement

Competency Assessment - Final Assessment

Due 5:00pm, end of week 5 of placement
assessments.task_description:
This assessment includes two components:

  1. Placement Plan and Feedback Action Plan (placement plan) - Students must complete this plan in preparation for placement.
  2. Professionalism and Competency Assessment - Students will self-assess their progress and professionalism on placement at both an interim (end of week 2) and final (end of week 5) timepoint. Professional practice supervisors will provide feedback using the same form for both the interim and final assessment. 

See Blackboard for details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Due one week after the last day of placement by 5:00pm.
assessments.task_description: Students will produce a 2 page executive summary of their professional practice project. See Blackboard for details.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Professional Practice (Placement)

Students will complete 20 days of placement in community and public health nutrition during this time. Placement days are Mon-Thurs, more information on Blackboard.

Learning outcomes: L05
